channel.title: [Req] Uploader and a question
channel.description:
Well, first of all, could anyone perhaps provide an uploader with a form? Nothing advanced, just as long as it works and uses two different files (form in one and primary code in another file like upload.php.)
[hr]
How do I track page views? Is there any simple way of doing this?

item.title: [Req] Uploader and a question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Mod Taharok:

Thank you the Un-Named. I made the variable save in my database and am selecting it everytime someone views it. Thanks for the help.

Yeah, I suppose saving it to a db would be better. I don’t know a lot of php.

Read full topic

item.title: [Req] Uploader and a question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:1, topic:92296”]Well, first of all, could anyone perhaps provide an uploader with a form? Nothing advanced, just as long as it works and uses two different files (form in one and primary code in another file like upload.php.)

[hr]

How do I track page views? Is there any simple way of doing this?[/quote]

The most simple and easiest way of page views, is add the php equivalent of “i++;” at the top of each page, save “i” to a file and load it for your page views.

Read full topic
